Package frc.team1711.swerve.subsystems

Class SwerveDrive

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
      • frc.team1711.swerve.subsystems.SwerveDrive
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Sendable, edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AutoSwerveDrive
    public class SwerveDrive
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.SubsystemBase
    Utilizes SwerveWheel subsystems to create a singular, easy-to-use swerve drive.

      • flWheel

        protected final SwerveWheel flWheel
        One of the four SwerveWheel wheels. FR is front right, RL is rear left.

        One of the four SwerveWheel wheels. FR is front right, RL is rear left.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SwerveDrive

        public SwerveDrive​(SwerveWheel flWheel,
                   SwerveWheel frWheel,
                   SwerveWheel rlWheel,
                   SwerveWheel rrWheel)
        Creates a new SwerveDrive given SwerveWheel wheels. Note: SwerveDrive(SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, double) should be used instead if the wheelbase and track are not equal.
        Parameters:
        flWheel - The front left SwerveWheel
        frWheel - The front right SwerveWheel
        rlWheel - The rear left SwerveWheel
        rrWheel - The rear right SwerveWheel

      • SwerveDrive

        public SwerveDrive​(SwerveWheel flWheel,
                   SwerveWheel frWheel,
                   SwerveWheel rlWheel,
                   SwerveWheel rrWheel,
                   double widthToHeightRatio)
        Creates a new SwerveDrive given SwerveWheel wheels.
        Parameters:
        flWheel - The front left SwerveWheel
        frWheel - The front right SwerveWheel
        rlWheel - The rear left SwerveWheel
        rrWheel - The rear right SwerveWheel
        widthToHeightRatio - The ratio from the track to the wheelbase (the distance between the centers of the front or back wheels divided by the distance between the centers of the left or right wheels). SwerveDrive(SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel, SwerveWheel) is recommended if this ratio is 1:1.

    • Method Detail

      • inputDrive

        public void inputDrive​(double strafeX,
                       double strafeY,
                       double steering,
                       boolean useInputDeadbands)
        Drives the SwerveDrive given strafing and steering inputs, all on the interval [-1, 1], where +y is forwards and +x is to the right.
        Parameters:
        strafeX - The strafing speed in the x direction
        strafeY - The strafing speed in the y direction
        steering - The steering speed, where a positive value steers clockwise from a top-down point of view
        useInputDeadbands - Whether or not to treat strafeX, strafeY, and steering as UI inputs (i.e. whether or not to apply the deadband set by setDeadband(double) to these values). true means the deadband will be applied.
        See Also:
        steerAndDriveAll(double, double)

      • steerAndDriveAll

        public void steerAndDriveAll​(double direction,
                             double speed)
        Steers and drives all wheels in the same direction and with the same speed. targetDirection must use the system where 0 represents steering directly forwards and an increase represents steering further clockwise. speed must be on the interval [0, 1], where 1 represents directly forwards.
        Parameters:
        direction - The target steering direction
        speed - The speed to drive at
        See Also:
        inputDrive(double, double, double, boolean)

      • steerAllWithinRange

        public boolean steerAllWithinRange​(double direction,
                                   double marginOfError)
        Steers all wheels to a direction within a certain range. Direction and margin of error are measured in degrees. The direction should use a system where zero represents directly forward and an increase in direction represents a further clockwise steering direction from a top-down view.
        Parameters:
        direction - The target steering direction
        marginOfError - The acceptable margin of error
        Returns:
        A boolean, which is true when all wheels are within the range, and false otherwise.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops all modules immediately.

      • setMaxOutput

        public void setMaxOutput​(double _maxOutput)
        Sets the maximum possible drive speed of a swerve wheel.
        Parameters:
        _maxOutput - The maximum possible drive speed.

      • setDeadband

        public void setDeadband​(double deadband)
        Sets the input deadband for inputDrive(double, double, double, boolean) (i.e. sets the minimum input value required for it to count as being a nonzero input).
        Parameters:
        deadband - The new input deadband
        See Also:
        deadbandDefault

      • setSteerRelativeSpeed

        public void setSteerRelativeSpeed​(double steerRelativeSpeed)
        Sets the sensitivity of inputDrive(double, double, double, boolean) towards steering inputs.
        Parameters:
        steerRelativeSpeed - The new sensitivity
        See Also:
        steerRelativeSpeedDefault

      • setDriveRelativeSpeed

        public void setDriveRelativeSpeed​(double _driveRelativeSpeed)
        Sets the sensitivity of inputDrive(double, double, double, boolean) towards driving inputs.
        Parameters:
        _driveRelativeSpeed - The new sensitivity
        See Also:
        driveRelativeSpeedDefault

      • accountForDeadband

        protected double accountForDeadband​(double value)
        Places an input value on interval [-1, 1] to either [deadband, 1] or [-1, -deadband]
        Parameters:
        value - The value to place within the deadband
        Returns:
        The value, after accounting for the input deadband
